thread.title: Dawson blows past Banks to set up region championship shot
thread.title_full: Dawson blows past Banks to set up region championship shot

author: Morgan Lee
title: Dawson blows past Banks to set up region championship shot
text:
By Morgan Lee Sports Editor Dawson County quarterback Coey Watson Related Articles 2015 High school football rankings 2015 High School Football region standings (VIDEO) Game of the Week : Banks, Dawson chase for history sets foes on collision course Week 9: Playoff chase hits critical mass for several area teams, regions (VIDEO) 
DAWSONVILLE — Dawson County made its separation statement on Friday. 
The Tigers emerged from the muddled pack of teams chasing the Region 7-AAA title with a 39-0 win over fellow contender Banks County in Dawsonville. 
The victory, combined with other results around 7-AAA, pushed Dawson County into sole possession of first in the region (thanks to a head-to-head win over East Hall) and means the Tigers will play for their first ever region title next week when they take on Lumpkin County in Dawsonville. 
On Friday’s evidence, the Tigers certainly seem ready for the challenge. 
Dawson (5-3, 4-1 Region 7-AAA) scored on six of its first seven possessions (the only miss coming on a kneel down to end the first half) and used a 21-point blitz at the start of the third quarter to put the game out of reach. 
Quarterback Coey Watson and receiver Tucker Maxwell proved especially deadly, hooking up for three touchdown passes -- the senior receiver’s only three catches of the night, going for 140 yards total. 
Banks County (5-3, 2-2) will look to bounce back at West Hall next week. 
Check back later for a complete game story. 
SCORING SUMMARY
